title: City Announces Closing, Delays Due to Impending Winter Storm
description: Republic Services has informed the City of Sweetwater that due to anticipated inclement weather, Friday trash routes will begin early at 4:30 a.m. Residents should make sure your bins are at the curb before then for collection.

title: US airlines offer to waive fees ahead of big winter storm
description: U.S. airlines are already announcing backup plans for passengers ahead of an expected winter storm this weekend that could be the biggest of the season and cause massive disruptions to air traffic nationwide.

title: West Virginia men's basketball hopes hard times are in the past, but time is running out
description: MORGANTOWN, W.Va. — Time, West Virginia men's basketball coach Ross Hodge warned on Wednesday night, is not on his Mountaineers' side this year.

title: Air Search plane cleared for take off
description: A GLOBAL administrative issue which left the Channel Islands without a search and rescue plane has been resolved, clearing the Lions’ Pride for take off. The Channel Islands Air Search plane had been forced out of service after the United States Federal Aviation Administration ruled that the registration company handling its paperwork was found to [...]The post Air Search plane cleared for take off appeared first on Jersey Evening Post.

title: High-end Tampa home remodeling firm expanding into Orlando, plans 70 jobs
description: Revive Design and Renovation, a Tampa-based home remodeling company, is expanding into the Orlando market with a new $750,000 showroom and 70 employees.The new Revive showroom will be at 601 S. New York Ave. in Winter Park. The 5,000-square-foot shop is currently under construction and expected to open this spring.(The property is the former home of Ethos Vegan Kitchen, a restaurant that closed in 2024.)Justin Caballero, Revive’s founder and president, says in a statement that the company is investing in the Orlando market because it “sees the same dynamics that fueled our success in Tampa, rapid growth, strong home values, and a high concentration of homes ready for thoughtful, award-winning, high-end renovations.”The company says it expects to profit from a strong demand for remodels in Orlando’s Windemere neighborhood and Winter Park.Revive Design and Renovation’s Tampa showroom and design center is at 3102 W. Kennedy Blvd. Founded in 2020, it serves clients both in the Tampa Bay and Sarasota markets, with, a spokesperson says, its Sarasota work focused on high-end beach front homes and in Lakewood Ranch.The spokesperson says in an email that the Tampa operation supports more than 200 jobs, including full-time project managers, designers and in-house craftsmen, as well as subcontractors and suppliers.The Orlando center, according to the statement, will create those 70 jobs mostly in the same categories.Revive was ranked No. 81 on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing companies in the U.S. in August. According to the publication, it saw 3,947% growth over three years.
